The county assessor‚Äôs office is helping drive this initiative through a new agreement with the Public Service Company of New Mexico that will put in place at least three electric vehicle charging stations in the PNM parking structure Downtown.

author: Marlon Ettinger
title: Trump Media Short Sellers Called Out By Nunes As Manipulation
text:
Trump Media CEO Devin Nunes sent a letter to Nasdaq on Tuesday calling on them to do more to monitor what he claims is rampant illegal short selling against the company‚Äôs stock, which trades under $DJT.
According to Nunes‚Äô letter, he suspects that the company‚Äôs stock might be subject to so-called ‚Äúnaked‚Äù short selling.
Short sellers, which Nunes and $DJT investors have decried for months as committed to seeing the company fail, essentially place a bet against a company that their stock price will go down. They do that by borrowing a stock from a broker, selling it on the market, and hoping that when they do have to finally buy the stock outright from the broker they‚Äôre borrowing it from, it‚Äôll work out to be cheaper than what they initially sold their borrowed stock for.
Short selling is completely legal, and investors have made hundreds of millions of dollars betting against Trump Media stock, despite high fees associated with the risky trading method.
But Nunes, Trump Media, and their supporters have waged a media campaign against the short sellers since the stock went public, claiming that the short sellers have been using an illegal method known as naked short selling. Naked short sellers never actually officially borrow the stock before selling it on the open market. Because they never actually have the stock in hand, the seller can‚Äôt deliver the stock at the end of the transaction because he never properly owned it in any way.
Trades that go in that direction are classified as ‚Äúfailures to deliver‚Äù (FTD).
According to Nunes‚Äô latest letter, SEC data for the first half of May shows that FTDs for $DJT exceeded one million shares on seven out of ten days, and two million shares on three of those days.
Because of that pattern, which could show stock manipulation, Nunes reiterated a call for Nasdaq to cooperate with a potential congressional investigation into the allegations.
He also called on big financial firms like Citadel Securities, Jane Street Capital, UBS, and Velocity Clearing, among others, to provide the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority with electronic blue sheets, which are records of their trading data.
Trump Media has been particularly aggressive in its public messaging against short sellers, pitching the contest as a battle between Trump‚Äôs enemies, the short sellers, and his supporters, many of whom have bought the stock as a personal investment in the president.
But not everybody online is happy with the steps Nunes has taken in recent months, as well as the trajectory of the stock, which is hovering around $46 a share.
‚ÄúWhen is TMTG going to start and pump Truth Social,‚Äù asked @PeteG in the $DJT group on Truth Social, Trump Media‚Äôs flagship social media platform. They complained that Trump hadn‚Äôt mentioned the stock in a long time and that Nunes was doing nothing but ‚Äúsending letters to the oblivion.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe really need a strong Catalyst, even the idea of forward progress might be enough to get the ball rolling,‚Äù they continued. ‚ÄúPeople have put up quite a bit of income to get us to this point just to watch these short scumbags hold our heads just ever so slightly under water. We just need a solid F U uppercut to the jaw and its lights out.‚Äù
But other posters encouraged doubters to just hold tight.
‚ÄúWe hear you, it can be frustrating. I see a huge mouse trap being set‚Ä¶‚Äù theorized @hughster. ‚ÄúPatience is our virtue‚Ä¶ Trump/Devin/Swider and others‚Ä¶. It will be epic IMHO.‚Äù

title: 5 receitas com peixe para a Sexta-feira Santa
text:
A Sexta-feira Santa √© marcada pelo simbolismo da f√©, por isso, muitos fi√©is escolhem o peixe como card√°pio principal para a data. O
ND Mais separou cinco pratos √† base de peixe para o feriado. Tem sardinha, til√°pia e at√© salm√£o.
1 ‚Äì Batata com sardinha
Ingredientes
- 2 colheres de sopa de manteiga
- 1 cebola pequena
- Batata cozida
- 2 latas de sardinha
Molho
- 2 ovos
- 200 ml de leite
- 1 pitada de pimenta do reino
- sal
Modo de preparo
Fritar a cebola na manteiga e reservar. Em um refrat√°rio, colocar uma camada de batata, a cebola frita e a sardinha. Preencher com mais uma camada de batatas e o molho. Finalize com o queijo e gratine por 20 minutos.
Para o molho, basta misturar todos os ingredientes.
Ver essa foto no Instagram
2 ‚Äì Fil√© de peixe cremoso ao forno
Ingredientes
- 5 batatas
- 200 gramas de fil√© de til√°pia
- 1 cebola picada
- Piment√£o vermelho
- Piment√£o verde
- 200 ml de leite coco
- Sal
- Tempero a gosto
- Salsinha e cebolinha
Modo de preparo
Em uma panela com √°gua adicione sal, a batata em rodelas e cozinhe. Tempere o fil√© de til√°pia a gosto e doure na frigideira. Na mesma panela adicione uma cebola picada, meio piment√£o verde, meio piment√£o vermelho e misture.
Adicione 200 ml de leite de coco, 340g de molho de tomate, 200 gramas de requeij√£o e misture muito bem. Tempere, finalize com salsinha e cebolinha.
Em uma travessa monte a receita com o fil√©, molho, batatas e finalize com o queijo. Leve para gratinar e est√° pronto.

3- Til√°pia marinada com v√°rios temperos
Ingredientes
- 800g de fil√© de til√°pia
- 2 tomates cortados
- 1 cebola cortada
- 1 piment√£o vermelho
- 1 piment√£o amarelo
- 4 dentes de alho
- 2 batatas em rodelas finas
- Suco de 1 lim√£o
- Sal
- Temperos a gosto
Modo de preparo
Marinar o peixe com o tomate, piment√£o, alho, sal e temperos por uma hora.
Cubra o fundo da travessa com uma cebola em rodelas, coloque as batatas, o peixe e cubra com o tempero da marinada. Finalize com o azeite.
Cobrir o fundo da travessa com uma cebola, coloque as batatas cortadas sobre a cebola, coloque o peixe e cubra com os temperos da marinada. Finalize com azeite.

4- Fil√© gratinado com batatas
Ingredientes:
- 500g de fil√© de til√°pia
- 1 batata grande em rodelas
- 200g de queijo mussarela
- 100g de queijo parmes√£o ralado
- 1 cebola pequena picada
- 1 litro de leite
- 2cs de manteiga
- 2cs de farinha de trigo
- 1 caixinha de creme de leite
- salsinha picada (a gosto)
- sal, pimenta do reino, p√°prica doce, noz moscada (a gosto)
- azeite
Modo de preparo
Temperar o fil√© de til√°pia e deixar marinando no m√≠nimo 30 minutos. Cozinhar a batata at√© ficar al dente, cerca de 10min √© o suficiente.
O creme de leite de caixinha pode ser substitu√≠do pelo de lata, pelo fresco ou pela nata.
Ver essa foto no Instagram
5 ‚Äì Fil√© de salm√£o com molho de lim√£o e queijo
Ingredientes:
- 1 lim√£o em rodelas
- 1 fil√© de salm√£o
- Lemon pepper
- Azeite
- 2 colheres de sopa de manteiga
- 1 cebola picada
- 200ml de nata (1 pote)
- Pimenta do reino + cominho
- Queijo mussarela a gosto
- Tempero verde
Modo de preparo
Corte o lim√£o em rodelas. Tempere o fil√© de salm√£o com Lemon pepper a gosto e acrescente azeite, misture bem. Em uma frigideira, adicione a manteiga, azeite e sele o salm√£o, dois lados, reserve.
Coloque mais um pouco de manteiga na frigideira e acrescente a cebola, deixe dourar. Adicione pimenta, cominho a gosto, acrescente a nata, queijo, e as rodelas de lim√£o.
Coloque o salm√£o, vai regando com o molho enquanto o peixe cozinha. Finalize com cheiro verde e sirva.

author: Grace Opinker Grace.Opinker@nwi.com
title: Region football players make Division I dreams come true on National Signing Day
text:
The early signing period officially opened on Wednesday. Here's a roundup of National Signing Day ceremonies held in Northwest Indiana.
Morton celebrates milestones
Lebron Hill didn't miss a route when he stepped onto the football field for the first time as a teenager. The 6-foot-5, 195-pound wide receiver proved his determination could earn him a Division I scholarship, even if he's only played the sport for a few years.
"Just a year and a half ago I was just playing basketball. I really wasn't taking football that serious," Hill said. "Football changed my life."
Hill was surrounded by friends and family as he signed with Vanderbilt Wednesday afternoon in Morton's black box auditorium.
Governors' head football coach Mac Mishler took pride in Hill receiving a scholarship from an SEC university without having to attend a high school outside of his hometown.
People are also reading‚Ä¶
"To be given this opportunity to commit to the school that I'm committed to, it took a lot of hard work and dedication in the classroom, and I'm thankful," Hill said.
Morton linebacker Freddy Brown officially became a Bronco after signing with Western Michigan. Brown said football has always been the one thing to get him through tough times and it's a dream come true to continue pursuing it in college.
"I remember coming in, I wasn't confident that I would get to this level at all," he said. "I didn't think I was good enough but as I showed up every day and put in the work. I saw the potential within myself to keep playing."
Morton also celebrated quarterback Holland Harris on signing with Division II University of Indianapolis.
3 Merrillville standouts sign
Nearly 100 friends, family, teammates and coaches gathered Wednesday afternoon to honor Merrillville's John Peters, Trent Nixon and Adam Camphor as they signed national letters of intent with universities across the Midwest.
Pirates head coach Brad Seiss said Wednesday was not only a big day for each player and their families but also Merrillville's football program as a whole.
"The rewards that they get are also rewards for us," Seiss said. "The fact that you have kids going to the next level, they're able to represent our football program."
Peters, who played wide receiver and defensive back, will continue his athletic career at Western Michigan. The three-star recruit had 36 total tackles, one sack and one forced fumble this season. Peters scored eight touchdowns, including a pick 6.
After his signing, his eyes became watery as he noticed his mom crying tears of joy.
"I told my mom I was going to make it out of Merrillville and she didn't believe me at first," he said between pauses. "Now I'm showing her that I'm not going to fail her."
Nixon, a linebacker, led the Pirates in sacks. He said he wouldn't have wanted to go anywhere aside from Northern Illinois. The future Huskie said he's worked his entire life to perfect his game and continue playing at the next level.
Camphor was surrounded by his mom and siblings as he signed with Southeastern Missouri State. Seiss said Camphor is the Pirates' first football player to become a Redhawk.
Andrean's Finley heads to NIU
Jimmy Finley was a threat on both sides of the ball for Andrean. He led the 59ers in touchdowns (12), interceptions (5) and receiving yards per game (61.7).
The three-star recruit was also featured on SportsCenter's Top 10 in October after having a one-handed catch against Hanover for the No. 1 play of the night.
Finley said he ultimately made the decision to sign with Northern Illinois because the coaching staff has treated him so well. Between watching film with their coaches and envisioning himself practicing with the team, it was a perfect fit.
"It's always been a dream of mine since a little kid (to play on TV) watching college football with my dad and brothers," he said. "It means a lot to me having all the people in the world watching me and having my family watching me."
Crown Point boasts 3 signees
After going almost 15 years without a Division I player, Crown Point's football program has had seven players go DI in the past three years.
Noah Ehrlich, Lucas Szymborski and Jacob Soley each signed with a school in the Midwest.
Ehrlich, the Duneland Athletic Conference's Offensive MVP, will continue his athletic career at Miami (Ohio). Szymborski will head to Ball State and Soley to Indiana State.
Holley becomes a Jayhawk
Four-star recruit Adrian Holley ‚Äî the highest-ranked recruit in the area ‚Äî will continue to represent Michigan City as he heads to Kansas. Holley had 12 sacks and 84 total tackles for the Wolves to close out his high school career.

title: Wildly Inappropriate Video Of "Hamas" Attack In Seoul Gets Produced And Distributed By Israeli Embassy In Korea - Koreaboo
text:
The Israeli embassy in South Korea is facing intense criticism for releasing a video ‚Äúdramatizing‚Äù a terror attack on South Korean citizens, with the tagline ‚Äú Imagine if it happened to you.‚Äù
| Al Jazeera The video depicts an imaginary scenario where a Korean woman is abducted by an armed assailant on Christmas Day and is forcibly separated from her daughter. The Israeli embassy posted the video on Facebook on Tuesday with a caption that said, ‚ÄúOn October 7, Israel was attacked by Hamas terrorists. 1,200 men, women, and children were killed, and over 240 people were taken hostage in Gaza‚Ä¶Imagine if it happened to you. What would you do?‚Äù
üáÆüá±üáµüá∏üá∞üá∑ In Israel, it appears that they have taken their campaign in the ongoing conflict to an extreme. The country‚Äôs embassy in South Korea has released a video illustrating what would happen if Hamas were to attack the Republic of Korea on Christmas Day.
One of their main‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/3kvRHpjkzg

According to YTN ‚Äòs report, Israel‚Äôs ambassador in Seoul, Akiva Tor, had explained the embassy‚Äôs position in a now-deleted social media post.
We have reconstructed the horrifying terrorist incident that took place on October 7th to help South Koreans in East Asia, far away from Israel, understand the current war situation.
‚Äî Akiva Tor
This video was produced in the context of Israel‚Äôs ongoing campaign to destroy the Palestinian resistance group Hamas in retaliation for its attack on October 7. According to Israeli figures, the attack left around 1140 people dead, civilians included. Hamas also took around 250 hostages, and 129 of them still remain in captivity.
On the other hand, Israel has relentlessly bombed the Gaza Strip since October 8, killing at least 21,110 people, over 5,000 of them being children, according to UNRWA .

However, Seoul‚Äôs foreign ministry deemed the Israeli embassy‚Äôs video ‚Äúinappropriate,‚Äù given the security situation of South Korea, which is still technically at war with the North, and asked the embassy to take it down.
The killing and kidnapping of Israeli civilians by Hamas cannot be justified, but the Israeli Embassy‚Äôs production and distribution of a video drawing parallels to the security situation in another country was deemed inappropriate.

Upon the foreign ministry‚Äôs objection, the embassy eventually had to take down the video in question.

O novo sal√°rio m√≠nimo nacional, de R$ 1.412, passa a valer a partir desta segunda-feira (1¬∫). O valor responde por um aumento de quase 7% (R$ 92 a mais) em compara√ß√£o aos R$ 1.320 v√°lidos at√© dezembro de 2023.
O c√°lculo tinha sido antecipado pelo g1 e inserido como previs√£o no Or√ßamento de 2024. O decreto assinado pelo presidente Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva (PT) foi publicado na √∫ltima quarta-feira (27).
Com este novo valor vigente, quem recebe o sal√°rio m√≠nimo (ou m√∫ltiplos dele) ou benef√≠cios vinculados a esse valor ‚Äî como o seguro-desemprego e o Benef√≠cio de Presta√ß√£o Continuada (BPC), por exemplo ‚Äî j√° recebe o total reajustado no in√≠cio de fevereiro.
O sal√°rio m√≠nimo √© a menor remunera√ß√£o que um trabalhador formal pode receber no pa√≠s. A Constitui√ß√£o diz que trabalhadores urbanos e rurais t√™m direito a este rendimento m√≠nimo, fixado em lei, unificado em todo territ√≥rio nacional.
Esse valor deve ser capaz de atender √†s necessidades vitais b√°sicas: moradia, alimenta√ß√£o, educa√ß√£o, sa√∫de, lazer, vestu√°rio, higiene, transporte e previd√™ncia social. O sal√°rio m√≠nimo deve ter reajustes peri√≥dicos que lhe preservem o poder aquisitivo, "sendo vedada sua vincula√ß√£o para qualquer fim".
Isto significa que, pela Constitui√ß√£o, ele tem que ser reajustado ao menos pela infla√ß√£o, para garantir a manuten√ß√£o do chamado "poder de compra". Se a infla√ß√£o √© de 10%, o sal√°rio tem de subir pelo menos 10% para garantir que seja poss√≠vel comprar, na m√©dia, os mesmos produtos.

author: Amy Wakeham
title: Ikos Odisia, Corfu: Family Fun in Seamless Luxury - Travel
text:
Ikos has brought its luxury all-inclusive offering to Corfu with its breathtaking new family hotel, Ikos Odisia.
C&TH Guide to Responsible Tourism
Ikos Odisia, Corfu: Hotel Review
Having kids can really ruin your holiday fun. While precious annual leave was previously used for spontaneous adventures, or city breaks feasting on the best culture Europe has to offer, or hours spent snoozing on a sun lounger, now they come with a little person (or two or three) in tow ‚Äì who invariably has their own, very specific, ideas about what a holiday should and shouldn‚Äôt look like (and it probably doesn‚Äôt involve reading the latest Sunday Times bestseller in the shade with an Aperol in hand).
But there is a middle way. Ikos has been redefining the luxury all-inclusive family holiday since 2014, when it first launched its Olivia resort in Halkidiki. Its latest offering, and second on the emerald island of Corfu, is Ikos Odisia, comprising 60 acres of beautifully designed rooms and villas, delicious F&B, impeccable service ‚Äì and plenty to keep the whole family busy.
STAY
There are 390 rooms and suites to choose from at Ikos Odisia, from the beautiful pool-view balcony rooms, to the Deluxe two-bedroom bungalows with their own private swimming spots. These are all spread out over the 60-acre estate, and surrounded by lush, impeccably landscaped gardens, and a whopping 10 swimming pools (although some are for Deluxe guests only). Every room is luxuriously furnished with calming neutral tones, and comes stocked with luxurious Anne Semonin Paris products.
EAT
Scattered throughout the resort (don‚Äôt worry, golf carts are available to get you from A to B) are its eight restaurants, ranging from traditional Greek cuisine, to crowd-pleasing Italian, to Peruvian fusion.
We were stupendously looked after at Elia, Odisia‚Äôs fine dining destination perched on the cliff overlooking the glimmering Ionian ocean. Sitting on its terrace, watching the sun set behind the mountains of Corfu, while feasting on contemporary versions of classic Greek dishes, made for an evening to remember. We also booked into Azul, the resort‚Äôs innovative Peruvian restaurant, for a mouth-watering change to the Mediterranean fare, washed down with Pisco sours.
Day-to-day, for breakfast, lunch and dinner, there is also Flavors, a laidback, buffet-style restaurant that caters to all the family without compromising on quality or taste.
DO
For many families, the most important thing about a holiday destination is the childcare on offer. Ikos Odisia offers a range of childcare services, from the creche to clubs for both kids and teens (including a football academy). Plus, there‚Äôs also babysitters to hire, and the resort offers 30 minutes of complimentary childcare on the beach or by the pool.
Once the kids are sorted, there‚Äôs a multitude of activities on offer for parents who feel up to leaving their sun loungers: complimentary gym classes; tennis, basketball and volleyball courts; water sports; and a luxurious spa offering a range of treatments by Anne Semonin Paris. In the evening, there‚Äôs live entertainment to be enjoyed alongside cocktails in the al fresco bar.
If you want to explore Corfu island a little more, the resort even has complimentary Teslas that can be booked for the day: The White House, the home of Lawrence Durrell in the 1930s, is only a half hour drive away.
If you fancy exploring Corfu Old Town, built in the Venetian style with tiny, winding, cobblestone streets interspersed with ornate Orthodox churches, then the resort runs a shuttle bus throughout the day. Once there, the NAOK Azur bar overlooking the Old Fortress and marina is the ideal place to sip a sundowner before dinner.
FINAL WORD Ikos Odisia is carefully considered to provide the latest in family luxury, with an effortless, all-inclusive offer that caters perfectly to the whole family. With its gourmet dining, gorgeous grounds and impeccable service, it means that parents can have the holiday of their dreams ‚Äì even with the kids in tow.
BOOK IT ikosresorts.com
Amy was on holiday when this review was conducted.
